column5: Air fried potatoes with tofu scramble packed on top, surrounded by spinach, Chao vegan cheese laid on top, baked then topped with avocado and sriracha.

Kind of yes! Brujeria is often lumped in with Santeria in all the resources I‚Äôve looked at online. Santeria is more associated with the Caribbean/West Africa- Brujeria isn‚Äôt tied to a specific Latin-American country, as what you practice is different for every country, and every region of every country. I follow some people online who are brujas from Puerto Rico, Argentina, Brazil, Mexico, Colombia, the southwest of the US, etc... And they all practice different things. It‚Äôs really interesting :-) It‚Äôs semi-obscure though, since the way you usually learn is through word of mouth through elders in your family.

Brujeria is a kind of Mexican/Latino folk magic. It roughly translates to ‚Äúwitchcraft‚Äù, and a brujo/bruja is a ‚Äúwitch‚Äù. It often combines folk magic coming from pre-colonization days and (sometimes but not always) Catholic imagery. Brujeria is often looked down on by the church and religious Latinos because Brujas are often associated with the devil. Brujas can choose to do ‚Äúdark‚Äù magic but many choose not to. Brujas are not to be confused with Curanderas (who practice Curanderismo), who are folk healers who use herbalism, magic, and religion to heal others. Curanderas are generally seen positively.

My grandmother grew up in a rural village in Mexico, and the only healthcare they had was from the services of a curandera. My grandmother knows so many remedies and practices kitchen magic regularly. I identify as a brujo, but some things between brujeria and curanderismo intersect/overlap, so I use my grandmother‚Äôs herbal remedies when I deem it appropriate. My dad‚Äôs friends also know many brujos and brujas and seek their help regularly, so I‚Äôm no stranger to them.

Seems kind of out there but it‚Äôs a big cultural thing. :-)
9-10 usually. Though last night I slept 3.5 because I‚Äôm manic.
Buildup of trauma and being in an abusive predatory relationship as a teenager (They were 20, I was 15) shot me into my first manic episode, and also gave me my first taste of psychosis.
My boyfriend is Danish-American and I am Mexican-American. He is a Quaker and I am a Brujo. I think we make an interesting match :-) Almost 8 months strong now.

Um... My family accepts me just fine. My family loves my cooking and my mother asks me every day to make her a lovely vegan meal for dinner. My uncles can be jackasses sometimes but for the most part everyone‚Äôs fine and supports me. My extended family buys me beyond meat whenever we have a BBQ just for me and grills it on a separate grill. You don‚Äôt know me or my family or my experience. The issue is separate from that.

I‚Äôm not saying that being vegan is easy for you. You know very well what it‚Äôs like to be vegan. It can be very challenging for everyone, especially if you have unaccepting family members, friends, coworkers, etc. I‚Äôm just saying that white people don‚Äôt know what it‚Äôs like to be a person of color, namely Latino. Being vegan and a person of color can be a little different because of different cultures. Being vegan can be challenging for everyone, but just in different ways. Sorry if it came across wrong.

Yeah, it took my dad over a year to come around. At first he‚Äôd poke fun at my food but then he started trying it once his high blood pressure got really bad. Now he‚Äôs almost in normal range :p But you‚Äôre right. Neither side fully gets it. Meat and dairy and eggs are ingrained in a lot of Latino cultures cuisines, and if your grandparents are rancheros (like mine lol), they REALLY don‚Äôt get it. My grandma has tried to serve me chicken broth on several occasions because she just doesn‚Äôt understand how you could possibly cook without animal products. I tried going vegetarian as a child and she‚Äôd serve me hot dogs because she didn‚Äôt know what to feed me. Then would be sad when I didn‚Äôt eat them lol.

And white vegans understand veganism in relation to them and their own experiences, but they are not people of color, so they don‚Äôt fully get it either. In my opinion, the way that culture and veganism intersect can be both a beautiful and incredibly stressful thing at times.

And I hope there is, somewhere on the internet. I might go look on Facebook now lol, a community would be really nice :‚Äù)

Hi I‚Äôm Mexican! And definitely. Every vegan I know online is white, and none of my family is vegan. They‚Äôre all omnis. It‚Äôs definitely a weird place to be. None of the vegans I know online ever know what I‚Äôm talking about when I talk about food, and my uncles always make fun of me for not eating meat. It‚Äôs kinda awful lol

Over the time that I‚Äôve been vegan though, I‚Äôve bonded with my mother by trying vegan Mexican recipes we find (I suggest M√°s vegan and Cocina vegan f√°cil on youtube) together and inventing our own. Although she is not vegan (I‚Äôm nudging her towards being vegetarian though, at least for a first step- she‚Äôs practically already there), it almost feels like I have a little community, as I cook for my whole family most days of the week and they always compliment me and go for seconds. I‚Äôve been interested in trying to see if there‚Äôs any online Latino vegan Facebook groups or something, since I know that community is what I personally need to feel happy.

You are not alone in this feeling I promise.

I don‚Äôt know what you mean by NUT25 (looked at mt. sac‚Äôs online courses and couldn‚Äôt find it), do you mean Introduction to Nutrition (NF25)? I took Jean Metter‚Äôs hybrid NF25 class and it was an easy A. Just do all the work and reading and you should be fine. No procrastinating either. I got 97% in the class last semester. The projects can be a little time-consuming but it isn‚Äôt too bad.
Good luck! Hope you get there soon :-)

I‚Äôve taken Introduction to Nutrition (NF25), Cultural and Ethnic Foods (NF28), and Vegetarian Cuisine (NF82). All easy. I took Metter and Cammayo. Just do the reading and the work and it‚Äôs an easy A. Nutrition classes are chill

Started my plant-based diet in December 2018. I‚Äôve lost 50 pounds and don‚Äôt feel greasy or generally gross after eating anymore. I don‚Äôt even really exercise either. 

I‚Äôm happy that it‚Äôs working for you! Changing the way we eat really does wonders!
Thank you so much!

I took it 4 years ago and was sleeping 16 hours a day. Tried it again with a new psychiatrist and it doesn‚Äôt make me drowsy anymore! We‚Äôre trying to see what dosage I need though. At 15mg and still having intense symptoms. Though its lessened my tardive dyskinesia which is good.

Wonderful! Love the colors. You can join us in r/SchizophreniaArtProj if you ever want to post art there too. :-)

I had my first psychotic episode around your age (at 16) so I know it must be scary. Keep in mind that your psychiatrist is trying to help you, but in the future if you don‚Äôt like your psychiatrist for whatever reason, you can request another one. Same goes for therapists- find a mental health team that you can get along with. I‚Äôve been to a mental hospital at 16 too- it‚Äôs generally boring. No phones, bad food, art therapy, having to do worksheets with 3rd grade math since you‚Äôre not in school, and teens trying to start trouble and compare mental illnesses. That‚Äôs just my experience though- I hope it goes well for you.

I hope you get everything figured out, and good luck.
I‚Äôve haven‚Äôt been doing so hot recently and this meme actually made me cackle for like a full minute. I feel this so hard. Thanks for posting :)

My bath does this. The plug doesn‚Äôt work so it drains slowly, and I have to keep putting water to keep the bathtub filled, and the hot water runs out. Drives me crazy.
I took Geodon and Trazodone at the same time and that med combo specifically causes irregular heartbeat. I‚Äôm not sure if Geodon by itself causes heart issues though.
Mental illness runs in my family, but trauma set off my first psychotic episode.

My mental health team tells me that I‚Äôm high functioning. I‚Äôm a college student with a 3.1 GPA, and I should graduate in 3 years... though I‚Äôm frustrated that it‚Äôs taking me this long. I‚Äôm entering the second half of my third year. I‚Äôm aiming at eventually getting my Ph.D and teaching English at the college level, though I‚Äôm still at a community college, so I have a long way to go.

I don‚Äôt have a job. Last time I had a job, I seriously felt like killing myself every day I was there. I‚Äôd curl up in bed and sob my eyes out whenever I got home. I‚Äôm only 20, so I don‚Äôt have a lot of experience though. I‚Äôve decided to only focus on school, and go full time with 12 units a semester.

I go to therapy weekly and see my psychiatrist once a month at least. Sometimes I see her once every 2 weeks, which I‚Äôm doing right now because I‚Äôm switching meds. I‚Äôve been on 8 psych meds total, and after 4.5 years, I‚Äôm still trying to find the right med combo. Some meds have really worked for me, but the side effects caused me and my psychiatrist to agree to try something else. I have tardive dyskinesia because of antipsychotics, it might be permanent but we‚Äôre not sure yet. I‚Äôm on Lamictal, Trazodone, and Abilify right now. Lamictal has saved my life, the only thing we‚Äôre working on right now is finding a good antipsychotic, so I hope Abilify works.

Although we‚Äôre not the closest, I do have friends. I see them every once in a while and we have fun. I have issues with moderation when it comes to drugs and alcohol (I don‚Äôt touch any of it anymore), so I‚Äôm lucky that they don‚Äôt partake around me. None of them know that I‚Äôm schizoaffective, but they‚Äôre supportive of my sexuality and gender identity so I feel lucky. I also have a wonderful boyfriend who supports me to the moon and back, and is the sweetest in the world when it comes to my symptoms. He accepts me wholeheartedly and I‚Äôve never felt that before, he makes me very happy.

My family is really supportive. When my symptoms get really bad, my mom stays with me the entire time and watches movies with me to help me calm down and get distracted. She listens to me and takes me to my appointments when I‚Äôm too tired to drive, or when I‚Äôm experiencing hallucinations. My dad and siblings don‚Äôt totally understand but they support me too. My extended family doesn‚Äôt know and I intent to keep it that way, or else I‚Äôll be gossiped about forever.

Overall I think my life is pretty okay. I haven‚Äôt felt depressed in a whole year because of Lamictal, so I can apply the skills I learn in therapy without depression getting in the way. My therapist is very proud of me for how far I‚Äôve come- she said I don‚Äôt really need constant therapy anymore but we‚Äôre gonna finish up DBT anyway. I feel fulfilled in my relationships. School keeps me busy and provides a routine for me, which keeps me on track. I think I‚Äôm okay because I have a lot of support in my life. Without it, I don‚Äôt know where I‚Äôd be. But I‚Äôm doing well considering the circumstances.
Me too. It made me feel like God was speaking to me. I don‚Äôt touch it anymore.

Not a voice, but I was convinced that Carrie Fisher was communicating we me through the lights, and that Cher was somehow connected to the phenomenon. They wanted me to create natural medicines to cure everybody in the world who was dying of diseases.
Love this!
Thank you so much!

My first psychotic episode was the result of years of trauma finally catching up to me and breaking me down. I resolved the trauma through TF-CBT but kept getting psychosis (and mania!) so me and my psychiatrist landed on the schizoaffective (bipolar type) diagnosis last year. That‚Äôs just me though.

Also I‚Äôm trans too. Nice to see other trans people on this sub.
This is awesome.
This is late but thank you so much!

I have 4 friends that I don‚Äôt see too often. I have trouble talking to them and relating to them but they seem to like me for whatever reason.

I also have some online friends, but I have trouble initiating conversations with them.
Sometimes so agitated that I want to scream and cry. üòû

Have been on both Latuda and Geodon since starting college 2.5 years ago. With Latuda I was at a C-average and could never get things done. On Geodon I‚Äôve had a 3.5+ GPA for each semester (not my total GPA) for the past year. I recently made my school‚Äôs presidents list and have been advised to join the honors program.

It‚Äôs definitely possible. Just need to find the right ones.

I have used dating apps like OkCupid and got some neat conversations out of it but nothing super spectacular. I know it works for some people though. Right now I‚Äôm dating a guy long-distance, and we share all the same values and goals while being loving and supportive of each other. We are planning on living together once he finishes his bachelors and I finish my masters. Long distance relationships are not for everyone but it is working for me.

I was diagnosed with bipolar NOS in 2016. I had a 4-day manic episode and a complete psychotic break, so they put me on medication. That turned to severe bipolar 1 with psychotic features in 2018 when I rapid cycled the entire year. Got my mood stable but still had psychosis so I got diagnosed with schizoaffective (bipolar subtype) when I had a psychotic episode last summer.

Like another person said, Metformin might help. I‚Äôm on Metformin and Geodon (weight neutral antipsychotic), both prescribed by different doctors. My endocrinologist said that Metformin can sometimes help suppress appetite, on top of it being a medication to help control blood sugar.

Currently on my third year at community college as an English major, but I‚Äôm hoping to transfer to a 4-year in Fall 2021 so I can finish a bachelors degree. I want to be a professor, so I‚Äôm planning on getting a Ph.D. Right now I‚Äôm trying to get into the honors program though. My grandma is bipolar and I know I have some sort of mental illness that runs in my family but it‚Äôs very frowned upon to talk about it. I don‚Äôt know anybody else with psychosis though.

75mg Lamictal, 200mg Trazodone and 80mg Geodon. Geodon has worked wonders for me but its worsened my tardive dyskinesia so we‚Äôre switching to Abilify 5mg. But Lamictal and Trazodone have saved my life.

I feel that. My psychosis, depression and mania are usually the main inspirations behind my drawings. Now that I‚Äôm mostly stable, I just haven‚Äôt picked up my markers... There‚Äôs some pretty good advice in this thread though. I might try some of it myself.
This is so cute!!!

I wish you the best.

If you go to Arrivals at LAX, there should be signs for every different airline. Drive until you see the American Airlines sign then park nearby. Make sure you‚Äôre at the International section of the airport, not at the domestic flights. He theoretically should be coming from there. But yes, I agree that it‚Äôs a good idea to track his flight.

My boyfriend is 19 and I am 20. Closing the distance seems kind of far away since we‚Äôre both in college, but we already have a plan, so it gives us both hope. I essentially get paid to go to college, so I‚Äôm able to cover a lot of the costs for our trips. While he‚Äôs in Chicago for most of the year, he comes home for breaks, and is conveniently across the state from me, so visits aren‚Äôt outrageously expensive. I think we‚Äôre pretty lucky.

Best of luck to you and your boyfriend. I hope you can see him soon. :)

I (20M) spent this past summer writing an 85,000 word fanfiction, and he (19M) was one of my avid readers. We so happened to be in a shared discord server, and every time I updated the story, he‚Äôd @ me in the server and tell me how much he liked it. He eventually friended me and starting PMing me each time I updated, even if I didn‚Äôt promote the new chapter. I always knew he was different. I took notice to him very early on and was fond of him, and he later admitted that he thought I was really cool and intimidating since he was a fan of my content. I started finding excuses to message him, and we started talking more and more. He told me he wanted to hug and kiss me but I still somehow didn‚Äôt catch on LOL. I eventually admitted that I liked him, and his reaction was basically, ‚ÄúI thought we already established that we liked each other?‚Äù... Guess I‚Äôm that dense. :~)

We‚Äôre both in college right now. I‚Äôm planning on at least completing a masters, if not a Ph.D. I‚Äôve already established that I want to move in with him after I finish my masters degree, which should be in about 5 years if everything goes to plan. We‚Äôll either stay in my city (which is a good city for his career), or we‚Äôll move to another state (to other cities that will also be good for his career) together. I want to try and get into a fully funded Ph.D program so that I can go to school and still live with him.
Wow. This is powerful. It captures the feeling well.
Worked great for me. No delusions or hallucinations at all. I‚Äôm getting off of it though since it worsened my tardive dyskinesia.

I live for myself. I‚Äôve been stable before on meds, and I‚Äôm hoping that I can be that way again. If I don‚Äôt fight tooth and nail for my future, I know I‚Äôll drown. Some days I don‚Äôt feel like fighting against my illness, and some days I fall victim to it, but I think just living moment to moment is enough sometimes.

My psych said that she was gonna take me off of my antipsychotic and ‚Äúwe‚Äôll go from there‚Äù, but she said she‚Äôd work on getting me stable again after we figure this whole tardive dyskinesia thing out. I had it on my last antipsychotic too though.

And I‚Äôve been managing okay, but thank you :~)

When I was 16. I was severely traumatized from various forms of abuse in my childhood, so things were already bad as I kept getting more and more depressed/suicidal from the unresolved trauma, then I broke into psychosis when I was at the tail-end of a failing ‚Äúrelationship‚Äù with an adult who was grooming and emotionally abusing me.
